content: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?><?xml-stylesheet type="text/xsl" href="http://mrdata.usgs.gov/carbonatite/carbonatite.xsl"?><record id="2"><country>Australia</country><cntrycd>AUWA</cntrycd><stprov>West Australia</stprov><depname>Cummins Range</depname><latitude>-19.2866666666667</latitude><latdeg>-19</latdeg><latmin>-17</latmin><latsec>-12</latsec><longitude>127.1625</longitude><londeg>127</londeg><lonmin>9</lonmin><lonsec>45</lonsec><discdate>1978</discdate><mintype>s\ufffd\ufffdvite</mintype><oreton>3.55</oreton><deptype>10</deptype><niobium>0</niobium><ree>2</ree><p2o5>11.2</p2o5><grades>Jaques (2008); 1% Re2O3 cutoff to 80 m depth within weathered zone, including 216 ppm U3O8</grades><depage>1012\ufffd\ufffd12 U-Pb, zircon; 854\ufffd\ufffd57 K-Ar pyroxene</depage><agemy>1012</agemy><tectset>southern apex of Precambrian Kimberley block at junction of Halls Creek and King Leopold mobile zones</tectset><rocks>breccia, carbonatite, carbonatized pyroxenite, pyroxenite</rocks><rocksmap>gneiss, graywacke, phyllite, slate   (Archean)</rocksmap><orebody_fm>plug</orebody_fm><ore_a>1.8</ore_a><ore_area>2.4</ore_area><ore_b>1.7</ore_b><alttype>amphibolization, carbonatization</alttype><altwidth>0</altwidth><comments>At +2% Re2O3 cutoff: 1.1 Mt at 3.5% Re2O3 and 1.3 Mt at 414 ppm U3O8 (Jaques, 2008). Best intersections include also 14 m at 0.64% Nb2O5, 18 m at 0.49% ZrO2, 9 m at 0.05% Y2O3 (Navigator, 2007). Apatitic rocks contain ?1.27% SrO.</comments><mineral role="ore">aeschynite</mineral><mineral role="ore">allanite</mineral><mineral role="ore">apatite</mineral><mineral role="ore">baddeleyite</mineral><mineral role="ore">barite</mineral><mineral role="ore">bastnaesite</mineral><mineral role="ore">chalcopyrite</mineral><mineral role="ore">columbite</mineral><mineral role="ore">fluorite</mineral><mineral role="ore">magnetite</mineral><mineral role="ore">monazite</mineral><mineral role="ore">parisite</mineral><mineral role="ore">pyrite</mineral><mineral role="ore">pyrochlore</mineral><mineral role="ore">pyrrhotite</mineral><mineral role="ore">sphene</mineral><mineral role="ore">thorianite</mineral><mineral role="ore">zircon</mineral><mineral role="gangue">alkali amphibole</mineral><mineral role="gangue">biotite</mineral><mineral role="gangue">calcite</mineral><mineral role="gangue">chlorite</mineral><mineral role="gangue">diopside</mineral><mineral role="gangue">dolomite</mineral><mineral role="gangue">phlogopite</mineral><reference>Andrew, R.L., 1990, Cummins Range carbonatite, in Hughes, F.E., ed., Geology of the mineral deposits of Australia and Papua New Guinea: Melbourne, Australasian Institute of Mining and Metallurgy Monograph 14, v. 1, p. 711\ufffd\ufffd713.</reference><reference>Jaques, A.L., 2008, Australian carbonatites\ufffd\ufffdtheir resources and geodynamic setting: 9th International Kimberlite Conference. Extended Abstract no. 91KC-A-00347, 3 p.</reference><reference>Navigator Resources Ltd., 2007, Rare Cummins Range, July 17, 2007, 6 p.,</reference><reference>http://http://www.navigatorresources.com.au/asx/NAVASXCummins17July2007Final.pdf (last visited February 3, 2009)</reference><reference>Navigator Resources Ltd., 2007, High grade rare earths confirmed at Cummins Range, September 18, 2007, 5 p., http://www.navigatorresources.com.au/asx/NAVASXCummins18-09-07FinalRevised.pdf (last visited February 3, 2009)</reference><reference>Navigator Resources Ltd., 2007, Quaterly Report, December 31, 2007, 17 p.,</reference><reference>http://www.asx.com.au/asxpdf/20080131/pdf/3177clpzl3r380.pdf (last visited February 3, 2009)</reference></record>
